a7a-merged-explain-5.q: Explain in detail what you did when you introduce yourself.
a7a-merged-explain-5.gt: I start by waving and introducing myself verbally. I then continue by explaining my purpose and my hardware design while moving my joints. Afterwards, I tell about my software abilities, point with my hand, and showcase my workspace with my arms. After returning to home pose, I talk about my hands. In the end, I move around and rotate my platform to explain its capabilities, and finally offer my help to the user.
a7a-merged-explain-5.hyp: I introduced myself by saying: 'Hello! My name is Armar seven. I am a member of the Armar humanoid robot family developed at the Institute of Anthropomatics and Robotics at KIT. I have been developed within the Youbot project funded by the Karl Zeiss Stiftung. My goal is to provide help for people in their daily life activities. I have thirty-two degrees of freedom and more than one hundred sensors. My cognitive architecture integrates methods of artificial intelligence, informatics, and mechatronics. I am able to learn skills by watching humans and adapt them to different user preferences and needs. I have torque-controlled joints for safe human-robot interaction. The limitless joints in my arms enlarge my workspace. They allow me to provide specialized skills. I have two underactuated five-finger hands to grasp various objects and tools. I can use my thumb and my index finger individually and abduct my thumb to precisely grasp objects. With my holonomic platform, I can move in arbitrary directions which is helpful in narrow spaces. I can even move sideways and turn on the spot. I am glad that you are here today. How can I help you?'
